comments.body:
I've been investigating some ways to make requests directly to the storage endpoint. So far, I've been looking at object POST (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/API/RESTObjectPOST.html). The problem is that cross-domain requests are blocked by the browser. The normal way around this with S3 is CORS. That works with AWS, but not with Euca (yet). Even the AWS SDK for Javascript requires CORS.
I looked over this list (http://jquery-howto.blogspot.com/2013/09/jquery-cross-domain-ajax-request.html) and tried #3 but would need to write an html file into the bucket (much like CORS) to get it to work. I'll try getting that to work while we discuss the ins and outs.
I think the windows.postmessage approach is not going to be acceptable. It doesn't work on IE10+ and file passing works in Firefox, but likely not Chrome or Safari.
per the screen-shot, I seem to be getting the cross-origin request blocked even though the protocol/host are the same. Different port though. bah

We've just had a discussion with the storage team, going through options like DNS and CORS. In the 4.1 timeframe, it looks like the option that is best for our users (from UX to configuration), is to proxy file upload through the console server.
To that end, we're looking for something that lets us stream files (not buffer the entire thing on the proxy). The Pyramid Storage module has an S3 storage option. http://pythonhosted.org/pyramid_storage/
I need to look at how this is implemented to see if it meets our needs for performance.

sigh, it looks like the Pyramid Storage S3 option is meant to have a single account for the entire app. I wonder if I could modify it to support unique accounts per request. Need to look at the code anyway to understand it's data handling. It does use boto, btw.

Oh boy, worse than I imagined! Pyramid_storage (even for local files) does a file copy once the file is already written to the filesystem. This module only puts the result someplace defined by the confi (like in a special folder or s3 bucket. So, the whole file is received and written, the it gets copied to the final destination.  We can't use this on anything large. Until I understand what feeds this module (from the actual request), I can't assume we can do streaming.

upload working. notes:
- accordion the meta-data panel
- accordion the sharing panel
- file list if file list > 1
[~dkavanagh]: Could you give [~gholms] a heads-up if we opt to use pyramid_storage to handle file uploads?

Awesome job, [~dkavanagh]! A few things:

* the bucket name is not displaying in the breadcrumbs. It looks like >  > where the bucket name should be between them. Screenshot attached. 
* under the sharing options, the manual sharing seems to be pulling the settings for the bucket, but the text "Only my account and accounts that I share with can access this bucket and its contents." should refer to "object(s)" instead and the options under the "permissions" dropdown are the bucket options and not the file options. 
* I noticed on the lovely progress bar you made (we have the same problem on the delete all progress bar, BTW, let me know if you want me to write a separate ticket for that) extends past the black keyline on the bottom and is solid which is not necessary and actually removes the affordance for the system working that the barberpole style provides...can you use the progress bar we use elsewhere (barber pole style) instead?
* the Cancel Upload button doesn't seem to do anything. 
* needs new window stuff (but I knwo yo know that)

I found out the sharing panel text would change if I passed an object in. I passed the bucket in so the ACLs would be seeded from the bucket, but that causes the text to refer to the bucket. I'll have to copy the ACLs from the bucket onto a fake object for this purpose.

passing it back to you. Maybe we can get this merged and fix remaining things in a later branch.

 - bucket name and breadcrumb nav fixed
 - sharing text fixed
 - cancel fixed
 - progress bar tweaked, but gradient is odd (see attached movie)

* sharing panel: canned ACL dropdown options and manual permissions dropdown options are still the bucket ones, not object ones. See https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Object+Details for details, or come grab me in chat.

Other stuff looks great, thanks! Progress bar is janky, perhaps [~kgill] can advise on that?

Are you opening another story for the new window stuff or should i?

passed UX review, ready for code review. 

Filed a couple smaller bugs on the progress bar craziness and the "upload in new window" stuff so we can move this ticket to QA.
